title: Coconut-Crusted Key Lime and White Chocolate Mousse Pie

Ingredients.4: 0.5 cup unsalted butter, at room temperature

Ingredients.10: 1 (14 ounce) can nonfat sweetened condensed milk

Ingredients.12: 0.5 cup freshly squeezed lime juice, or more to taste

Ingredients.14: 3 tablespoons coconut cream, or more to taste

Ingredients.17: 8 ounces fat-free frozen whipped topping, thawed

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease the bottom and sides of a 9 1/2-inch glass pie pan with shortening.

Directions.2: Beat sugar and butter for crust in a bowl on medium speed until smooth. Beat in flour, lime zest, and vanilla extract on low speed just until crumbly. Press evenly into the bottom of the prepared pan.

Directions.3: Bake in the preheated oven until light golden brown, 13 to 16 minutes. Remove to a wire rack and let cool completely, about 30 minutes.

Directions.4: While the crust is cooling, grind shredded coconut in a food processor into a coarse powder.

Directions.5: Spread coconut powder thinly over the cooled crust.

Directions.6: Prepare filling: Whip condensed milk, sour cream, lime and Key lime juices, and coconut cream in a medium bowl on low to medium speed until smooth. Add more lime juice or coconut cream to taste; it should be quite sour but not bitter.

Directions.7: Melt white chocolate chips in a microwave-safe bowl in 15-second increments just until soft. Mash with a spoon, then quickly add to the filling mixture and whip immediately on high speed to evenly distribute. Whip in food coloring on low speed, then gently fold in whipped topping.

Directions.8: Pour filling into the pie pan. Cover and refrigerate until filling is fully set, at least 12 hours.

Directions.9: Remove from the refrigerator. Shave white chocolate with a vegetable peeler over the pie to decorate. Serve immediately or refrigerate until serving.
